definition[0]: a very dangerous situation in which the material inside a nuclear reactor melts and burns through its container, allowing radioactivity to escape
definition[1]: a situation in which prices fall by a very large amount or an industry or economic situation becomes much weaker
example[0]: The stock market crash might lead to financial meltdown.
definition[2]: a situation in which prices fall by a very large amount or an industry or economy becomes much weaker
example[1]: A near meltdown in overseas stock markets sent U.S. prices plunging for the third consecutive day.
example[2]: The situation is serious, but new measures have been introduced aimed at preventing a financial meltdown.
